name: Elizabeth Park Conservancy
address: 1561 Asylum Ave, West Hartford, CT 06117, USA
reviews: A lovely place to visit anytime of the year. Bearing in mind that flowers are seasonal and peak season for roses is in June.  This gorgeous park also offers many gardens of other flower varieties to enjoy in spring, summer and fall.  Year-round visits take you through acres of walking trails winding around specimen trees and other lush vegetation.  An occasional spotting of a Great Blue Heron at the pond with other water fowl makes it extra special.  After meandering about relax on a bench or bring your own blanket and take in all the beauty.

The park is beautiful with lots of areas to walk around and different gardens full of roses. The pond is lovely. The Pond House restaurant in the park is also great. It's a lovely place to visit in all seasons, and great for walking the dogs too!

Well 1st off,it's winter so nothing was in bloom. However I love parks and I ended up there as I was doing some rideshare driving and I found my way in the area and couldn't resist. So the layout is beautiful. the park was very clean. Some parts looked romantic. I also love tree's. So I enjoyed those. I'm definitely going back when everything blooms. They had all the different species(of rosebushes) labeled.
Good place to be when your stir crazy from quarantine. Social distancing and great scenery

So pretty to walk around. The area is not huge but the space is well taken care of and a nice visit of you have some time and friends to walk and talk with :) great place for pictures if you like floral and landscape/garden settings. Depending on when you go some flowers might be going out of season so go earlier in the summer for a fuller scene

name: Connecticut Science Center
reviews: Great place to spend a day with the family. Lots of fun and learning activities. There is a 3D theater with several shows a day. Butterfly exhibit is very enjoyable. If you are lucky, a butterfly may just land on you. There is a separate fun playground-like area where the kids can play with the water-based machines. For the water activities, there are rain covers available of various sizes. I would recommended that the parents bring a pair of water-proof shoes for the child since the feet do get wet. There is a food court offering a variety of sandwiches and pizza. There is a tea and coffee stand, a snack vending g machine and a Frozen yogurt stand.

In my option this is the best kids museum in the state. There are multiple floors of learning entertainment for kids of all ages. On the first floor there’s a water play area. On another floor there’s space, LEGO play zone, and an environmental area with live animals and. A flowing river to understand water dynamics. They always have rotating exhibits like a live butterfly garden and an energy STEM exhibit. The place is always clean and well cared for. A bonus is the great view from the top floor of Hartford and the Connecticut River. For food, there’s a subway and ice cream place. The gift shop has awesome stem toys. To note: the parking garage I the building is often full when there’s a convention at the convention center next door but there are other nearby garages within a block. 

In the past they have done an exchange with Mystic Aquarium whereby your membership at one gets you in the other for a month for free.

Wow, this place is packed with so many neat exhibits and things to learn and experience. You can touch, listen and play while learning with all ages. There's dinosaurs to how sound works to energy and lights. Great place to check out with kids or just yourself. Cant wait to go back.
Kids love to come here. They had a cool sock skating rink that the kids thoroughly enjoyed. They change out different areas which is nice so that there is always something new to see or do.

The CT Science Center is excellent on many levels...Six exactly.  The different exhibits they offer are for a wide variety of ages and they switch things out frequently enough that you never feel like it's an old hat.  We were gifted a membership and it's one of the greatest gifts we could have ever received.  Certainly one of Hartford's shining stars.

name: Bushnell Park Carousel
reviews: I LOVE this place! My kids and their friends do too! The staff is super friendly and accommodating. We just held a birthday party of my daughter who was turning 3 and I can't stop saying good things about my experience. Our guests loved the place, the helpful staff, and the facilities. The price for the birthday was ridiculously affordable, and the staff bent over backwards to ensure everything was perfect! This is gem in the Hartford area and more of us should support it!
Love the park the carousel,so nice. I visited when Santa was there, amazing experience they also had the ice skating what a experience the kids loved it. will be back for other future events.

It's not something you see very often anymore, a good old-fashioned carousel. what I found disappointing was that they had two signs hanging from the ceiling and very large print saying "BE NICE!" The explanation point was part of the sign not something that I added.
The horses are beautiful and it is a very charming place. I used to go there when I was little, and I still love it. :)
Free ice skating...yes..FREE  skates and Free ice time. They also have Free lessons on Saturday morning. It's Seasonal so check the website. They do sell Hot Chocolate.

name: The Mark Twain House & Museum
reviews: Enjoyed touring the Mark Twain House & Museum. The writer loves WOOD!!! so you will see the beautiful woods everywhere inside the house. The writer had a great taste for designing house requiring a lot of woods. Every room of the house I visited had been impressively restored to beautiful condition. Taking photos inside home and touching any thing is not allowed!!! Great historical location. Highly recommend so you won't regret!

As a big Mark Twain fan, this was a treat! Highly recommend the reenactor-guided tours. Our guide, Samuel's daughter Suzie, was so knowledgeable!  She made the tour especially interesting with little tidbits of information you wouldn't know to ask, all shared from Suzie's perspective. Truly a delight!

A fantastic museum and a look at a very different time and way of life. Easy to get to and park. Great museum store. Tour guides are fantastic. A bit pricey but totally worth it and there are different pricing options. Will go again for sure.

Of course this is a must place to visit if you are interested in culture, history and famous writers. Very interesting and informative tour. Guide is super friendly and knows a lot! Museum as well. Free parking. Clean restrooms.
Great living history tour.   Well worth the trip.  Will come back  and take the tour by George the Butler or the maid! Tour guide excellent!

name: Wadsworth Atheneum Museum of Art
reviews: A really impressive collection.  Plan on spending the entire day exploring the galleries.  Nicely annotated and displayed.   The cafe was a nice place for a light meal.  We will definitely need to visit again.

Weddings at the Wadsworth Atheneum are my new favorite thing! As a professional photographer based in Hartford, I absolutely adore working there. The space is so inspiring and just perfect for art + Hartford lovers! You and your guests are surrounded by art and sculpture and color which creates a wonderful backdrop for your day. Love this venue as a Hartford local and artist!

History museum is really quite good. Better than I expected. A beautiful building easy to walk around and a very manageable collection. In addition we had lunch in the cafe and the food was great. I would recommend this excursion to anybody looking to spend some museum time in the Hartford area. It is $12 per adult for admission however.

A must-see visitors museum. A local favorite that many locals fail to enjoy to its fullest offering. The many galleries provide great viewing of rotating exhibitions and permanent ones.
Plenty of transportation options afford easy access to this great location in downtown Hartford. Free coat room services and nice cafe.
A beautiful home lovingly restored to the Clemons family era. Highly recommend a living history tour. George Griffin,the butler, gives a fabulous view.

name: Elizabeth Park Rose Garden
reviews:
I got married here and I recommend it to my mother in law and she also got ma
Tried there too. Great place to see some beautiful roses. Bring your dogs and take awesome pictures, kids and just friend with blanket conversing. We took great pictures here. I would recommend here for shoots

If you need a small walk filled with some flora you can actually casually admire, this is the place to be. When the flowers are in full show it may be busy and a bit noisy. All adjacent grounds are appealing too and worth a visit. Parking is spread out. There's a sit-down place to eat and a small path/ trail on the grounds.
This is always a great destination especially when the weather is good enough for a walk.
Lots of trails and beautiful gardens. Nice place to spend an afternoon.
Nice place to unplug, stretch your fit on green, and if lucky to see show on new build3 arena.  And flower, flowers.

name: Bushnell Park Foundation
reviews: This park is beautiful there's a lot to see a lot to do, whether you're into people watching, bird watching, I just watching the leaves fall. It is quiet, peaceful, and a place that I would visit again and again and again.

Neat and well-maintained park. Enjoyed walking around and taking pictures of the green space and the modest Hartford skyline. The place felt safe overall during the day. Street parking available close by.

Bushnell Park is clean a nice place to walk your dog place ball with your Kids or simply sit and watch all the people that are doing this type of things. Its a place where You could grab a blanket and have a picnic or just sit and talk. Very  Peaceful.

Bushnell Park is a gem in the heart of Hartford. I visited on a Saturday morning with friends and their children, and the kids enjoyed climbing, jumping, and swinging at the brand new playground, which just opened in November. It is located just next to the carousel, making for a fun few hours. I appreciated the way that the playground was designed to evoke nearby architecture, and my friends' elementary-aged son appreciated its educational aspect. He pointed out to the adults that there was information about how bills become laws, presented in a way that kids could understand. I don't often find myself in downtown Hartford, but my recent experience at Bushnell Park gives me a great reason to return.
Trees are dying.  Who is taking care of them?  The largest oak is in need of help.  Please attend to the trees.

name: Connecticut's Old State House
reviews: A good tour of the old state house.  Interesting history facts.   The room of curiosities was a surprise.  The basement had exhibits about Connecticut industry and history.

I've walked by The Old State House hundreds of times, but never thought to go in. When I finally did, the staff was so friendly and willing to give any information when asked. And they offered guided tours as well.
If you're a AAA member it's only $3 to get in. I spent about an hour here, about 15 minutes on each of the top floors and the rest on the bottom, which has a small museum set up about the History of Connecticut.
If you have a little time to spend, I recommend stopping in and giving them your support. And you can see a gorgeous painting of George Washington, one of the only originally located portraits by Gilbert Stewart in the country.
Amazing building. Historical information and unique items. There is information on on the 1839 slave ship La Amistad

Wonderful place to visit with always more layers to it than meets the eye. Long a centerpiece of Hartford and the state of Connecticut, this modest building packs in more exhibits and history than any single tour could cover. The tours are information-filled to be sure, and they leave you with your head buzzing and an appetite to learn more. The OSH is continually evolving, incorporating new historical facts, adapting to new audience perspectives and needs, and introducing new programs and ways of experiencing history that the modern visitor will find relevant and provocative.

I really liked taking the tour. The tour guide was super knowledgeable and you could tell she was passionate about the subject. She had answers for literally every question and detail. Methinks she studied extra information in her free time.

name: Cathedral of Saint Joseph
reviews: My mission is to visit all CT catholic churches and this was #39. There is Street parking and a lot behind the cathedral. The exterior is modern and 'cold' but the interior will take your breath away. Open, spacious and modern but traditional in that it had the stained glass. But it's all very grand and absolutely gorgeous. The ceiling lights are shaped like stars and they look 3-D. This is one of the most amazing churches I've seen to date.
I had a great pleasure to see polish folk music group "Ślask". Wonderful place, great acoustic. I love this place.
Wonderful liturgy in a Most beautiful church!  Organist and Cantor we're magnificent.  Preaching was extraordinary!

The House of  Our Lord. ,,it's a peaceful place to visit and pray
I felt the Holy Spirit coming to me.....

The Cathedral of Saint Joseph, the mother Church for the Archdiocese of Hartford, is always an inspirational experience.  The sheer size and height of the space are humbling but it's the enveloping affect of the stained glass windows the worshipper is left with.  The narrative expressed is clear and in combination with the intense colors, the overall experience is heartwarming, breathtaking, and draws the person forward to focus on the altar, the center of Catholic worship.

name: Riverside Park
reviews: Great place for just winding down or having a friends and family cookout. Kids are welcome, great play area, very clean. Peaceful. Gazebo is beautiful and the after serene
That's a go to store you find all kinds of good stuff

Very nice park overlooking the Connecticut river.  There are lots of things to do here for the entire family. There's a nice river trail for walking  connecting downtown Hartford, play area, basketball court wall/rock climb, and a Gazebo if you want to host a party or just getting together with the family. Also,  there's a boat house and I've seen people boating. There a sport area for soccer, etc.
Very nice park, only downside is it's close to the highway but that's hard to avoid
Great moon light hike along the Connecticut River with the River Front Recapture Group!

name: Museum-Connecticut History
reviews: Lots of great history! Self guided tour with lots of great information. Great price (free!)

This is the smallest state museum I've seen and the most in need of a budget infusion.  Times are tough, no one wants to pay for educational places.  Still, in their exhibit on Colt firearms, one of the typed tags had an incorrect word crossed out and rewritten.

Small museum that can be visited in under an hour. Admission is free. The exhibitions are a loose collection of local items and memorabilia. While interesting when seen individually, they lacked the cohesive story and narrative expected of a history museum. Also missing are the exhibitions that would fill the gap and allow visitors to piece together a story. Some serious curatorial work is definitely in order.

The museum is in an elegant building that also houses a public library and courthouse. Check them out as they are quite beautiful and picture-worthy.

Fascinating exhibits, which is focused on Connecticut’s government, military and industrial history, trace the growth of our state and its role in the development of the nation. The collections include portraits of 72 Governors of Connecticut, American coins from as early as the 17th-century and Colt firearms.

Interestingly, the 231 Capitol Avenue residence, which is located across the Connecticut State Capitol, is made up of Connecticut Supreme Court, State Library, and Museum of Connecticut History.
Spectacular building. Uber friendly staff.

name: Harriet Beecher Stowe Center
reviews: Really interesting conversations with the group we were with and our guide that added spice to an already interesting, awesome author. Different way of presenting a historical property and really focused on a forward thinking Harriet Beecher Stow. Also check out the Mark Twain house next door. Hartford was an exciting mecca of writers back in the day.
This was a fun last minute thing to do and well worth it. Our tour guide was well informed and funny. Made it well worth it... I had a great time and learned a lot. Thank you. Highly recommend. 👍🏻

An extremely well curated museum that recognizes the parallels between history and the present. The tour was enjoyable and relevant to modern events, despite taking place in a 150+ year old house. The house itself was beautiful and almost all of the furniture and art is original. Best of all, the gift shop focuses on modern political movements and writings that echo the importance of Beecher's work in her own time. This is an important museum in our time and does not feel like a dated history lesson. Well worth the trip.

Excellent historical landmark. The guides are very helpful. You will get a deep look into America's dark past of slavery. The ticket counter offers a discount of $3 if you show them your ticket from the more famous Mark Twain museum. This place also has a restroom, so it's helpful for travellers. There are also a number of food joints nearby, a little up the street like Domino's Pizza and some others.
Went with a field trip. The tour guides were great. They were informative and kept the children engaged.

name: Friends of Elizabeth Park
address: 1561 Asylum Ave, West Hartford, CT 06117, USA
reviews: The Spring flowers are blooming.   Beautiful display of Tulips.  Elizabeth Park is a true gem for Harford
Gorgeous ❤️
Awesome

name: Great River Park
address: 301 E River Dr, East Hartford, CT 06108, USA
reviews: Love the view and the length of the trail. Being by the water at any time of year is always nice.

Great place to walk by the Connecticut River or sit down on a bench and enjoy it. It has walking trails in case you choose to exercise or simply walk your dog. There is a boat dock in case you want to sail your boat on the river. You can cross the bridge in the end of the park and you are in Downtown Hartford within minutes. Great place for families.

Great River Park is a great place to take either a run or a walk in either Hartford proper or East Hartford.  Walker/runners can access The Riverwalk foot bridge  and cross the Connecticut River.  The whole park is scenic and there's other folks around during midday, which makes it a very safe place to exercise.

This park is one of my favorite places to go for walks. Depending on which direction you go, you will come across lots of wonderful things. One side has a lot of plants and cool trails of varying difficulty, and the other side takes you farther along the river and to different art installations having to do with a former U.S. president. It's really quite lovely. The walk has plenty of benches but due to the fact that the park floods up to a certain level every year, not all of the benches are safe to sit on. Overall, it's a nice easy walk in either direction that can get you some great photos and won't be too difficult if you have a mild disability or are in a wheelchair. It's also quite romantic at sunset, and a known spot for families and lone people that love the view from their car.

The only problem with this park is the stench from the trash to energy plant across the river, It's a shame that the d.e.p. does nothing about it.
I am hoping it closes soon! I have complained for twenty years plus to no avail, this facility has ruined Hartford,  East Hartford, Wethersfield, and anywhere else you can smell the rotting garbage!

name: Butler-McCook House & Garden
reviews: A wonderful museum with a unique setup where part of the home is a more traditional museum space and the remainder is a historic house museum.  The history of the family is very interesting and the architecture of the home is stunning.  We had a young high school student as our guide on Connecticut Open House day and he was wonderful!  The garden in the back is very peaceful and worth a moment of quiet.  You can't even tell that you are downtown Hartford.
This was my first visit to the Butler McCook House. The garden is beautiful. I was surprised at the amount of Chinese artifacts that were there in addition to the New England treasures!

This is a fascinating place to delve into Hartford history through the lens of a family who stayed in their house over many generations while Hartford downtown grew up around them. Four siblings last lived in the house until their deaths, and the story of their lives captured the interest of our whole family.
Great location for music with Among the Acres

Truly an Oasis in the middle of a City Desert(Concrete Jungle), with a beautiful assortment of flowers, bushes, and trees, it is another world inside the city of busy businessmen, we need to slow down and smell the roses😁🖖❤🙏

name: Soldiers & Sailors Memorial Arch
reviews: It is a huge arch. This memorial is such a majestic city landmark. Its so beautiful even just driving through or gazing from Bushnell Park. We couldn’t climb but Im sure it would be worth it. This is truly a gem in the middle of the Hartford. Autumn season is the best time ti visit.

Eye-catching structure welcoming visitors to Bushnell Park and the State Capitol. I was curious about its history so I checked the park website and learned that:

"The arch was dedicated on September 17, 1886... to honor the 4,000 Hartford citizens who served in the Civil War, and the 400 who died for the Union... Be sure to read the bronze plaque under the freed slave which honors the 128 African American residents of Hartford who fought for the Union...

This Gothic monument is made of brownstone from Portland, Connecticut, and cost about $60,000 (from the city treasury) to build."
Very nice park! Lovely to take a stroll around! Great views of the capital. A little piece of history!
When you’re in Bushnell Park, it’s worth a diversion just to look at this edifice up close...its really a marvel of engineering and worthy of one’s eyebrows to be raised for what it memorializes!
Historic, iconic.

name: Fernridge Park and Pool
address: 567 Fern St, West Hartford, CT 06107, USA
reviews: Great Precious Vibe And Really Good To Enjoy With Familys And Friends..
It was great! My gkids loved it. I wish non residents could have the opportunity to buy the pass.
Really good place to spend some time or bring the kids. It has a lot of amenities (pool, spray park, baseball field, basketball, wide lawns, clean bathrooms among others).

This is an awesome park for toddlers and children. They have a playground there especially for younger children and another playground for older children. They have a digger and shovels and also have a few Tonka trucks for children to play with. They also have sprinklers and a pool.
We liked this park!!! The kid's place perfect for summer...the park with tables to eat and the playground area...There is a pool too.. so it is a perfect place to spend your summer time!!!!

name: Noah Webster House & West Hartford Historical Society
address: 227 S Main St, West Hartford, CT 06107, USA
reviews:
When I have visited it has always had an approachable, knowledgeable and friendly staff. The tour is through the house and newer additions and does not lack a piece of history at any turn. 

A definite Connecticut staple I suggest to anyone passing through, it took us a couple of hours at most but it was well worth the price of admission.

Words. Words. Words. Thanks Noah for making them American!  In 1828 his own Dictionary was published and the rest is history!  Webster’s Blue Back Speller gave us pronunciation and a commonality for equalized relations among our people. We still depend on his dictionary in schools and homes throughout our nation. This house is a little gem that brings his story to life.

A wonderful and informative place about the history of one of America's founding fathers noah Webster. Staff was friendly and informative helping us get the most we wanted out of the tour and prices were very reasonable.

NWH is a truly excellent museum. Featuring a fascinating history of the Town of West Hartford, the museum also showcases exhibits of general interest to the historically curious. 
Staff members are congenial,  personable and always willing to be of assistance with any and all queries.
On site parking is a bit limited, however, ample spots are available on South Main and local streets. 
A simply wonderful museum!
Went here with my friend from school; we had a very good tour guide who gave us the ins and outs of Noah Webster’s life and home. I really enjoyed the tour and home tour !

name: Charter Oak Landing
reviews: They are doing a wonderful job cleaning up since the flood! Very quiet relaxing place to go!

We go here for the Riverfront fireworks every year, and sit by the water, near the bridge. It's the perfect view of the display, and pretty easy to get out of. I haven't been here any other time, but it seems like a serene place

A place where you can relax from the rush of Hartford. Unfortunately not much to do here besides chilling next to CT river. If you have a bout you can lunch it to the river here for free however you have to check hours because the gate might be close.
Nice spot by the river... Place was desserted though...
Good place to take the kids to walk or ride their bikes on a weekend.

name: A. Everett Austin House
reviews: Very interesting tour of Chick Austin's house in the wealthy and beautiful area of Hartford!  He was the art director of the Wadsworth Atheneum from 1927-1944 and was innovative at the museum by introducing modern art to America. The house is a historic house museum built in the Neo-Palladian style and is only one room deep while being long in length. It is filled with 17th- to 20th- century Italian and German furnishings, with the second-floor modern style with Bauhaus designs.

A little oddity in Hartford. It's a private building and you cant get too close, but you can still get the idea from the sidewalk. Don't go out of your way to see it, but if you're in the area it's fun to check out.

Absolute gem. If you care about art, culture, or interior design in the 1930s, the Austin house is a must. The house has been lovingly restored and the tour guide was knowledgeable and very engaging. Also, just responding to another reviewer, thr Austin house is not private; it’s owned by the Wadsworth Atheneum and is opened to tours twice a month—you just have to call to book in advance. Well worth the $ and the time!!!
Interesting, not enough so to pay $25 for a tour of the inside though.
Beautiful

name: Westmoor Park
address: 119 Flagg Rd, West Hartford, CT 06117, USA
reviews: Very nice place to take the family too.  The employees are polite and its very scenic.  I love this place and would definitely go back.
Great scenery.  Fun summer camps.  Kind animals.  Apply a lot of bug spray before coming.

We first went here for a friend’s daughter’s first birthday, and have been back several times since with our own little girl. It’s a wonderful place to kill some time with little ones while being outside and teaching them about animals. You can’t beat the price (free)! We love Westmoor Park!
Beautiful place. Lots of farm animals and huge park
Fun family place to see the animals plus a safe nature walk through the forest. A quiet afternoon stroll.

name: Colt Park
reviews:
I've been a regular at Colt Park since 2008. I stopped going for a few years when there were two muggings in the middle of the day. I also was sick of the quad/ATV riders ripping through the place. 

While that has improved, the place is still trashy. There is literally trash all over the place. 

While the park does host many games, at most time it is empty. Part of the green new deal is to ensure everyone has access to outdoor space, but no one even uses what they currently have.
Awesome area. But restrooms needs to be open during daylight

It was a beautiful day to stroll through the park even at then of the day when all sporting events were winding up. The breeze was subtle, music was still playing in the background, kids still running back and forth on the courts- in the grass & some just snuggled in moms' arms as they watched the softball games. Nice progress on fixing the park in general.
Kids love the pool. Clean water.  The lifeguards actually form relationships with the  kids from the community my daughter knows their name. Please follow @blacksheep106
Convenient clean and safe with police providing drive by making sure things r safe.

name: Webb-Deane-Stevens Museum
reviews: unlike NY. CT. values their old homes. CT has so meaning historical house its one of the best states in the New England area. which makes Webb-Deane-Stevens Museum a wonderful stop. not only do you have the museum but the surrounding area is loaded with old homes which makes a great walk around town. the guides are very nice, litrtle gift shop and a very nice historical house that is now a restaurant. even my 12 year old enjoyed it. this in my book is a must to see. i hope you feel the same. in this post there will be a few picture of the restaurant and other homes that are near by.

Three different house tours at once, all homes unique and with their own stories. Our guide was wonderful. The staff was friendly and very accommodating when we showed up at the end of the day. You need a good two hours minimum here to really take it all in.
Three great colonial homes with a lot of history.  Our guide was passionate and knowledgeable.
They have a real electric chair. Follow me on ig @Emperorkaioyus

The venue is wonderfully maintained, definitely enjoyed the set up and breakdown of my brother's wedding here. The facility is so simple and easy to access, while still being away from the main road of the town.

name: Wolcott Park
address: 1341 New Britain Ave, West Hartford, CT 06110, USA
reviews: Made use of the picnic area for a barbecue (fireplaces no longer available). The park is kept very tidy and the sports and grass areas are always in very decent shape. Only issue is the parking areas can get very full at times - but street parking is nearby anyway. Bathroom facilities are within walking distance of the whole area. You may not be able to play every outdoor game here due to the terrain not being flat and it is situated next to a main road, but there is a pond and a wooded area away from these if you "need some nature".

Nice park. Great facilities to use. My only complaint is that the playground was a little boring for my kids over the age of five or so. However, the school playground is only a short walk up the path from there, which was a really fun walk! We spent hours here exploring, having a picnic, and feeding the ducks.
Always a pleasant park to walk around during the day if I'm out with my dogs. Great to see kids using the area all year round. Clean, safe, well- lit and lots of parking.
Very nice new playground and the kids will love cooling off in the splash pad. Parents will like all the shades benches to relax on while the kids play.
Clean and enough space for the kids to play.  Is missing a pool.  Great park for the kids to play sports

name: West Hartford Reservoir
reviews: This place was fantastic. I really enjoyed the fireworks and pyrotechnics!! However it scared my pet iguana and he scurried off into the lake. Please help me find my son thanks for the memories
Great beginner, to expert trails...
Beautiful sceneries, excellent trails, quiet roads, and family place.
Great place to walk or run here solo, with friends, with your kids or dogs.
Wonderful! Enjoying with our dogs even on rainy days... One of the best places for walking.

name: Riverfront Park
reviews: Great trails for walking or biking. Nice wide sidewalk along the scenic river. Expansive playgrounds for the kids. Boat launch near the huge dock and boathouse. Probably a beautiful spot for a wedding. The dog park is huge and super fun to watch. Bonus points if you bring water to pour in the water bowls for all. Very clean facilities throughout. We love this place.
This place is amazing.  I'm hoping that there is enough foundation to hold it all together.  This place is a beacon for me and my kiddos.
Great fenced in parks. One fenced in area for little ones and one fenced in area for big little kids. Only downside, no shade! In the summer it's too hot to play there.
Park with soccer field, baseball yard, basketball court,crew, playground, fishing dog park, picnic,relaxing place.
Nice park. Decent baseball field. Lots of bugs at night.

name: Pope Park
address: Pope Park Dr, Hartford, CT 06106, USA
reviews: I wouldn’t recommend anyone to bring their children here. Although the pool area is ok, the rest needs some serious TLC! First off the play area is always full of poop, from the geese and the homeless and addict sleep there so you can imagine what types of things are left laying around on ground that could potentially harm kids and/ or adults. I understand that everyone needs some where to 🛌 but it needs a major clean up.
Love the community center there! Also they have both an indoor and outdoor pool :)
Well the last thing that I want to go but it's a good place Salado people in
Best spot in downtown Hartford,CT

Always a nice place to go when it's nice out. Especially 🌻🌾🌷 spring and 🍃🌴🍂 fall. But winter ❄ is great for the kids ⛄ ❄ my son likes to go to pope park to see the ducks he usually brings 🍞 bread. As well as the playground area that's nice also... There's also a swimming🏊 pool but he hasn't been there for swimming yet.. But now that he reaches the specific height he'll be able to go in the pool area this year!!!!

name: Talcott Mountain State Park
address: Summit Ridge Dr, Simsbury, CT 06070, USA
reviews: If you're not scared of breaking a sweat on a walk and think of a vista as a reward, then it's the place to visit. There is an easier route to follow too. Generally the folks you encounter are friendly, but I did have a bit of a bad experience this time round with bringing my dog with (someone setting off fireworks nearby). Do note that if you're really wanting to appreciate the views, bring binoculars/ telescope with as you can see for quite a distance. Also, the cool place to go is the tower.

This is one of the best state parks in Connecticut. It becomes much more beautiful during fall. I visited last fall with my then 4 months old baby and it was her first hike. We hiked up till the summit. The views were gorgeous and beautiful. The hike to the summit was also good. Plenty of parkimg space available too.
Beautiful park. Nice hike, not to challenging. Stunning views and interesting history. The castle is very impressive and we can't wait to go back when it opens in May!
Was a great walk. Very pretty ..lots if cute wooden benches as you walk up. Where this trail starts it all up hill..so be ready! Lol..but was a great walk.

Beautiful wooded hike with an amazing view along the top of a "mountain". The majority of the hike is fairly close (or very close) to the cliff,  so if you have young children be careful. The park is well used; we were there on a weekday evening in the fall and passed approximately 20 other people in the park. There are a few different trails, one being a wide well cleared path away from the ledge, and another narrow slightly more rugged path along the ledge. There are few connector and side trail options, but they all essentially lead to the same spot. A gorgeous building at the peak. There's a gift shop and museum area, unfortunately they were just closing as we arrived. Note, there are one or two connector trail points, well marked, which cross this trail and are part of a much larger trail system, these do not lead to either the building nor the park parking lot.

name: Wickham Park
address: 1329 Middle Turnpike W, Manchester, CT 06040, USA
reviews:
Heavenly! This park is so beautiful! Wickham Park is a true hidden Gem! My first visit I couldn’t believe how large it was- totally exceeded my expectations! When you look at the views all around the park the first word I can think of is Heavenly! So many gardens to visit (total of 10 ranging from ½ acre to 8 acres!) and see all the different kinds of flowers and how it is set up. I was in heaven with my professional! So many different places and scenery for pictures of any kind! I always thought it was really neat to see they had the Aviary there; the kids also enjoy it! 
The sensory garden is my favorite ~ not just because my husband proposed to me in front of a beautiful statue where a couple bonded together holding hands and forming the shape of a heart . One of these years I will buy a brick with our wedding date on it  I recommend for anyone in CT to go and check this park out.

Great place to walk, jog, play Frisbee golf, play Pokemon go, or just work out on the trails.  I've only recently discovered this place but I will most definitely be buying season passes next year.  The grounds are maintained very well and the staff are super helpful.  The various gardens and sitting areas are beautiful. 
Very kid friendly for all ages.  There is a per car fee to get in or you can buy the season pass.

Wickham Park was an incredible experience. I attended my granddaughter's wedding here. The grounds, the "lodge", the scenery and the staff was totally fantastic. The view across the valley was amazing. The lodge's dance floor had ample room for everyone with the energy to dance the night away. The grounds with unique walkways that wound around a garden of trimmed shrubs and flowers - all leading back to the lodge. The entire staff was attentive to your every need. The night lighting was set to seclude if you chose and open enough to safely walk about the gardens. You will experience a memorable event with any venue here at Wickham Park. I surely did.

Beautiful park. The grounds and the landscaping are amazing. Great place to go with the family for an hour or two. The gardens are also amazing. You’ll see a great view of Hartford as well. They also have a small little bird zoo too!

This is a great Park that is far bigger and more interesting that I had originally imagined it.  If only for the sheer variety of things to see and do is Wickham Park worth visiting.  The various gardens on the grounds were beautiful and well kept even in October. Only down side was this place is clearly a destination for weddings and wedding photography and we couldn't go for more than few minutes without getting in someone's shots.

name: Connecticut Historical Society Museum and Library
reviews: We really enjoyed our visit to the museum. There was plenty to appeal to older history and war buffs,  as well as young children who can play "house" in a colonial setup. Lots of interesting CT history as expected, as well as interesting exhibits like a film about commercial items manufactured in CT and vintage toy commercials. We loved the war artifacts and left with a feel for historical CT sentiment regarding the Revolutionary and Civil wars. We had lots of laughs in the canoe display.

The place is large and well organized, when you enter someone tells you where you should go. The duration in depends on how fast you see things but it is between half an hour and an hour. On the second floor there are many fun and educational activities for children. 
We went today because it was free the entrance but if you have to pay l don’t know how much.

A lot of information you can learn about CT by visiting CT Historical Society Museum in Hartford. The museum is open for public for free first Saturday each month. However, I was surprised to see the size of the museum and the artifacts they have I thought since it's named CT historical society, I thought it would be bigger and the most museum that has artifacts in the state.

We have visited the Connecticut Historical Society (CHS) Museum in Hartford, Connecticut multiple times, most recently on Saturday, January 5, 2019, and have always enjoyed it. Both the permanent and special exhibits in this museum have consistently been nice representations of Connecticut’s history. Although we only were able to spend about an hour and a half at the museum this time, we estimate that it would take at least two hours to see this museum and appreciate all that it has to offer. Admission into this museum was free because it was the first Saturday of the month but museum passes may be available at your local library for free admission on other days.
Loved the museum and the standup storytelling show they host.

name: Dinosaur State Park
address: 400 West St, Rocky Hill, CT 06067, USA
reviews: Fun and educational.   I love that they constructed a building over the tracks.  All of the accompanying exhibits were great too. Very interactive.   I liked that one of the staff came out for a presentation.   I've seen so many dinosaur skeleton exhibits in other places. This was great to have a place focused on tracks. There was so much to learn.

Fantastic place. A hidden gem in the middle of Connecticut. The staff do a great job of bringing the history of the park together with the history of the dinosaurs that once roamed the area. Great for a family day trip or a school field trip.
Fantastic park and amazing exhibit.  I highly recommend stopping by!  The exhibit is totally worth a drive over.
My kids loved this place! They enjoyed so much we had very nice afternoon here.
A hidden gem. Such an impressive site. Can't believe I never knew about the park till now. Actual fossilized dinosaur tracks. Wow!

name: Heublein Tower
reviews: You have to go there during the fall! You can really enjoy the beauty of Connecticut. A great hike. I have also seen lots of families.

Visited this place during fall and the view from top on a clear day was amazing, during the hike there are several view points from where you can catch amazing views and see beautiful fall colors. The hike is not very tiring and it is just over a mile so it an easy hike with amazing views!!!
Great Hike, super busy many many people. First part is the hardest of the trail, the rest is a nice walk. The views are beautiful! Nice little picnic area near the tower all worth it.
One of our favorite hikes.  There are different routes to get up the mountain, one is a little steeper than the other.  You still end up with the same gorgeous views!
Love the hike even if there are a ton of people. Fall is so beautiful up there. I just wish I picked the October fest weekend when the band plays. Easy hike, hard to find parking when busy.

name: Beachland Park
address: 847 Quaker Ln S, West Hartford, CT 06110, USA
reviews:
Newly renovated playground for the young and older kids. Has a nice pool/splash pad combination for the older kids. Has a separate fenced in splash pad for the younger ones. It also has a wheelchair accessible swing. Has a lot of picnic tables. 

There are also basketball court and other fields for sports.

After 50 years, this place still remains a true summer staple. Favorite time of year, as the masses have cleared out. My mom took me here in the 60s , so now it's my turn to bring her. We had an aquatic fun time!!

Newly updated playground and the sprinklers were open as well. No bathrooms available in the building next to the playground, but there is a Porta potty down the hill. It's cleaned once a week from the paperwork posted. Just bring disinfectant wipes for the seat. There was plenty of paper.

They have plenty of benches for family but unless you get there early and "claim" one, you might have to bring your own. People were grilling on small portable grills, no grills that the park provides. Huge amount of park space for these sort of gatherings. Not enough parking near the playground, but there is quite a bit down the hill by where the Porta potty is at.
Lovely park. Went to the temporary dog park with my pups. It was fun!
Probably one of the greatest playgrounds I've ever seen. My son really enjoyed it here. There was plenty of space to run around, two playgrounds depending on age.

name: Nomads Outdoor Adventure
address: 240 Governors Hwy, South Windsor, CT 06074, USA
reviews: Place is nice and interactive. Elementary school kids do not have much to do - only 2 rope course for them. They are not allowed to go to more challenging adventure for a good reason. But for given 3 hours you get with admission price it is enough. Choose warm and dry weather. You do not want to stuck in the mud there.Bring good snack and drink, you will definitely be hungry after all.

First time I look my daughter to Nomads and she loved it. Spend the entire session building our way up each level and missed finishing it as our time was up. Will return time and time again as it's a great way to keep your kid active and not stationary.

Amazing experience! Paul, Dave and Conner were great. Extremely helpful, friendly...can’t say enough about their personalities! 
I attended with three boys 10, 9 and 8...they made sure that we were okay throughout the duration that we were there. Great outdoor course...highly recommend! We will definitely return very soon!

Nomads Outdoor Adventure is an awesome friendly place to take your family for a fun active experience. The staff was very welcoming and very friendly. There price is very reasonable compared to other similar places around the area. One of there employees named Diego was very helpful. He was very quick to help my girlfriend when she fell and got stuck on one of the courses. The staff was always making sure that everyone was safe and doing good. The entire staff was very observant of everyone on the courses and were always very quick to help anyone that needed it no matter how big or small. I would highly recommend checking them out. My family and I will definitely be going back many times.
Great staff!  Always watching the climbers and acting quick if someone gets stuck.  The courses are well maintained and a lot of fun. Highly recommended.

name: Mill Pond Park
reviews: Its a nice place to admire the view and to see the ducks and also if you want you can even set up a picnic there. Its kid friendly and so the children can play, there is a park where the little ones can play

It’s a local park folks. Has a pond, fields , pool and a pretty big playground for the kids.
The waterfall is not a mile walk off a trail. It’s off the street. Great for locals to hang out or relax. The Ducks destroyed the baseball field with droppings otherwise as I said it’s a local park with some events during the summer.
Nice friendly visitors. Was surprised how much trash is in the bushes there. People , pick up after yourself please.

It's a great place for my toddler, she can do different types of games and be running around as the playground has a very decent size.
One plus is that the playgrounds floors are cushioned.

This is really one of my favorite parks here in the area. It is quiet and peaceful, very nice for watching turtles and a variety of birds.  It is always well-kept, easy and relaxing to walk the full loop around the pond.  The playground is extensive and has a lot of options and variety for kids so that there is plenty of space.  The playground's astro turf was delightful.  Felt like walking on a marshmallow. There is a public swimming pool, but I'm a little confused with the hours of operation since it has always been closed and the water level low every time I have seen it.  There's a baseball field, a basketball court, free parking... but always my personal favorite is the little waterfall under the bridge that you always see in pictures. My wife and I came here for wedding pictures.

name: New Britain Museum of American Art
address: 56 Lexington St, New Britain, CT 06052, USA
reviews: A lovely place to visit. Beautiful art, many events to be a part of including First Fridays with bands and dancing, painting classes. There's a lot to be a part of.
I took my my 3 shorties on Saturday morning to see the art museum. (Ages 7,6,5)  Was definitely worth it a couple hours. Was very nice. Was exactly what was expected. No WOW factor. But very happy.

Have not visited in decades. Went last weekend with our family and it is a beautifully remodeled building. Great activities for kids to do downstairs and was a great hour or so to look silently over the collections in the museum.

I have seen commercials for this museum on TV for a while. On the commericals, the place seemed really small to me. It never seemed like it would be worth the trip, but it was actually much bigger than I had expected.  It was a great afternoon with the kids. They are sculptures that surround the building which made for a nice walk before going inside.

Most of the art on the inside are paintings, of course.  The have a wide variety of art from various time periods and styles.  I'm not a huge art buff, but there are paintings there by several artists that are household names.

And the price was right.  The tickets for my 8 and 12 year olds were both free and my ticket was only $15.  A really nice afternoon family outing at a great price.
All the staff were very friendly during my visit, and there was plenty of good food in the cafe!

name: New England Air Museum
address: 36 Perimeter Rd, Windsor Locks, CT 06096, USA
reviews: Pretty standard museum. The collection was very impressive. The staff was friendly and knowledgeable. My kids enjoyed themselves a lot. There was a lot to see and read. My only disappointment is that most of the cockpits that were marked as being able to enter them were closed. Would have liked a bit more hands-on stuff. Otherwise a lovely way to while away an afternoon and I would recommend it.

If you are an aviation enthusiast, this museum is a great time!! It has fantastic displays. I was continually amazed at the quality and content of aircraft they have. Furthermore, unlike many air museums, New England has many many aircraft that visitors can sit in. There is a wonderful play area for children. But the best part is easily the Docents. They are each so kind and so knowledgeable about the museum exhibits but even more so, several of them flew and, if you’re interested, have many wonderful and funny stories. This museum is well worth the time spent there.

What a great museum, packed full of iconic planes. Staff were really friendly and helpful. I even got to talk with some of the guys that helped restore the B-29. I'm just going to post pictures instead of telling you why it's worth your time to visit.

Very cool place to see airplanes up close and learn about aviation. It's pretty awesome to hear the air traffic of Bradley while wondering the 3 massive hangers filled with cool planes. You can sit in SOME of them and having Veteran Volunteers really makes all the difference as you get REAL stories and knowledge from people who ACTUALLY flew these planes.

This Museum is a hidden gem. Lots of information on aviation, with plenty of hands on opportunities. This Museum also contains real aircraft you can see, touch and explore. The Museum is also easy to get to, with plenty of parking. Great place for all ages.

name: Hill-Stead Museum
reviews: Great place to visit. Kids would love to see how people used to live -150 years ago, with no internet, no iPads, more people in family. Very big house. A must see place.. Maintained pretty well. stuffed parrot Albert in the house would be one of the biggest attraction..

We didnt go into the museum but rather say on a bench and read . The grounds are breathtaking set up on a small hill looking out over the valley. I have been in the museum several times and it is wonderful also.

Great place to visit. Totally went there on a random day. They had feeding of the sheep with pumpkins from the community. The also had a wool spinner and you could buy wool socks and gloves. Taste apple cider donuts and apple cider. Very cool place to check out.
What a beautiful place.  Just outstanding. Highly highly recommended.
So great to see art in the way it was supposed to be displayed.  You really get a sense of history and a feel how they lived. Great experience, unique museum.

name: Church of the Good Shepherd
reviews: Very nice people. They offer soup and maybe food around 1130am-1230pm I think are the times. Not sure if its everyday or not. They sometimes have clothing they give away too. It's a old old church. I like the architecture of the old building.
Family church years. Great to visit and spend time with those you love. Beautiful buildings with history from the 1800s.
Beautiful church with lovely grounds to go and meditate.
Saturday morning 7am inspirational sermon, followed by delicious free breakfast, for those in need. All are welcome. Popular. Arrive at 6am.
The service was awesome.  Pastor Pope preached about the Blood of Jesus and One Hundred Fold Blessing.

name: Hartford Reservoir 6
address: 3070 Albany Ave, West Hartford, CT 06117, USA
reviews: Great place for a nice stroll or bike ride, not a picnic spot as there are not many benches to sit on the way. There are paved roads for bikes and people and non paved trail path with no bikes allowed. Lot of people with pets
Beautiful! Half open sky and half forest path... Nice and flat for an easy walk or jog!

What a beautiful day at the West Hartford
MDC Reservoir #6 💕
January 2020 !
Great place to take a long walk.  very scenic
What a great place to walk... It's almost 4 miles around the practically flat path. The views of the reservoir a quite impressive.

name: Connecticut Trolley Museum
address: 58 N Rd #9606, East Windsor, CT 06088, USA
reviews: My daughter and I love this place. For a reasonable price you can ride multiple historically accurate trolleys in the same day. On busy summer weekends they may have as many as four or five trolleys operating. They vary from open air cars to completely enclosed. Compared to other historical rail experiences like steam trains,  you have just about a 360 degree view around you from inside the trolley.The volunteers are very knowledgeable and do their best to make it an enjoyable experience for all.

Bought tickets for the holiday trolley ride, was told to go outside and we'll board in a few minutes. 30-45 minutes later, miserable children, miserable parents finally board. There wasn't even anything impressive to see on the ride. Just a few decorations at the start of the ride. After all this, they never checked our tickets. I didn't even have to pay for that poor experience. 😖
We did Holiday lights and had so much fun. My granddaughter who is almost 3 enjoyed meeting Santa Claus tremendously. The open sleigh trolley provided a true feel of the holidays.

We did the holiday light ride on 12/20/19 in the open car.  Don't waste your money.  We were the 1st ride of the night and we had to stop so someone could get out and turn the lights on at every display.  Also the tunnel affect lights were out for the last half of ride.  
Just rode in darkness.   We stopped at end of track and they tried to fix them but didn't work.  They had a radio station on that played a christmas Carol for the first minute or so then we listed to radio commercials for most of the ride.  Very disappointing!

Rails to the Darkside was much better than I anticipated. The actors do fantastic jobs, however, the wait is a bit long for the amount of scaring that gets done.

I'd definitely go again. Be sure to bring a very warm jacket! You'll be there for a while.

name: Lutz Children's Museum
address: 247 S Main St, Manchester, CT 06040, USA
reviews: My son is 19 months old and he loves Lutz. This was our second time visiting and we easily spend 2 hours there. It's a perfect outing on a scorching summer day.

For kids seven or younger this is a great activity for 1-2 hours. I love the kid's size storefront of downtown Manchester. Also some cool antique train sets.

It's a great place for kids to learn through play. The Lutz has a small but cool animal museum. Check out Flemish the rabbit.

Check your local library for discount passes. You'll save half off addmission.
It was a great experience for the first time for both me and the children. Thought it was going to be much bigger but still had enough activities and animals for the kids to enjoy. Will go again

I want to love this place, as I normally like supporting the arts, and businesses in our town. But for the price of admission this place charges, a lot of the children's play area is run-down. Paint is chipping off furniture, my son sat on a chair and almost fell apart. For the price of admission they should do more upkeep.

The Lutz Children's Museum has grown tremendously since it's humble beginnings and today is so much more than a "chidren's museum". It's a place to play, learn and explore for children of all ages and developemental abilities. The detail paid to the both the educational and play value if each display was stellar! Even adylts accompanying a child will enjoy your visit (with real antique toys displayer behind plexyglassto view) you will find nostalgia at every turn.

name: Kidcity Children's Museum
reviews: Kid City is such a great place for children. So many things for children to do, each part of the building has a different theme. we were there three hours. Saturday was packed with kids and adults. Our grandchildren were both sleeping on the way home.

The kids had a great time. You can pack a lunch and spend the day for $10 each. Adults must pay too. You find different things in the rooms you didn't see before every time you go. My kid loved the fishing boat room and the performance room.

My family and I live in CA, and we visit children's museums wherever we go. This one is my favorite as they do an outstanding job of integrating basic scientific principles with play. The museum used to be a large home/mansion and has several separate rooms to explore. There are quiet areas and bathrooms all over to relax, breastfeed, etc. I also appreciated all of the little touches, like signs about spare clothes' kits in case your child has a potty accident. Really cool kid's museum. My kids are 6.5 and 8.5 years old, and they didn't want to leave. So much to do. Budget at least 2 hours and longer is better.

Really fun! So many different themes and activities. Saw staff consistently rotating through swiffering the floor and putting toys back so no matter when you got to room, most likely it was set up the way it was intended and  not left in disarray from the kids. Nice to see a place that is well maintained despite the how rough and relentless the clientele can be.

Fantastic  place to bring the young ones.  The under 2 area is great when the little ones need some "waddle" space.  The 3 years old finds so many things that he loves.  This is one of his favorite places to go on our special outings.

name: Lake Compounce
reviews: What a great Amusement park. It’s got such a great classic feel mixed with great new rides. Tons of great places to get food. This park has water rides so bring a bathing suit but also has enough regular rides where you can have a great time even without one. This is the oldest amusement park in the US and it really has an old timer feel. This park also has rides for people of all ages. It also has wooden roller coasters that are not the best option for people with bad backs, so be cautious. Lake Compounce is especially beautiful in the Fall. With New England’s famous Fall Foliage and during Halloween time in particular there are extra fun events. The views from the park are also breathtaking. Lake Compounce itself is gorgeous and the wooded area surrounding the park are beautifully well
Its a fun place, but every time I go there is a ride broken down. They need to create a ride that is fine without any bumps. It was fun and they had great food.

Perfect for ages 2-7 but dress accordingly. The park is lite up beautifully, smaller rides going, hot cocoa and some Santa make for a perfect little evening out. People working at the concession stands could have been more professional but overall a great night!
Drove here from Pennsylvania, was not disappointed. Very nice park just what we expected. Small but charming.
Kids enjoyed this place. park that has been around a very long time but still has lots to do with many options. Watch out for the wooden roller coaster though very rough ride.

name: Northwest Park
reviews: My family loves this park! The grounds are well kept, and the park is very clean. My kids love the nature center and playground, and I enjoy hiking and exploring the trails. On our most recent visit we were even able to observe a maple sugaring demonstration in their sugar house. Very nice way to spend an afternoon.
Lovely park in Windsor.  Tons of trails, very choose your own adventure.  The nature center is quite cute.  Grounds are always clean.

Every year we have picnic there. The Pavilions are large and fine. The place is neat and clean and maintained. The tobacco museum has some old machinery to appreciate the history if you are interested in that stuff. Nice to walk around. The parking is free.

Great place to visit with family and friends. They have a few tobacco museums and also a nature center as well with description of the wildlife found in that area. They also have a decent children's play area. My daughter loved this place
Playground, covered barn, indoor nature center, 3 pavilions available to rent for parties, and many beautiful trails.

name: Vintage Radio & Communications Museum of CT
reviews:
Fascinating walk back through history of communication.  All the way back to Marconi. 
Many reminders of my childhood.  Ham radio, television production, old shows,. So much to see.  Very hospitable docents.  They love what they do.

Amazing museum for all broadcasting and media enthusiasts. A fair share of everything from the 1800's to the 90's. There's a fully functional HAM station that you can operate as long as you hold a HAM operator license. Keep in mind they only accept cash.

What a hidden gem! I expected to tour the museum in about an hour  to one and a half hour range, nope! Three hours later...and my teens were engaged the whole time, as was I! 
I recommend taking the guided tour since the volunteers are so knowledgeable, passionate (about all forms of technology) and extremely personable!
 We will definitely plan another visit, as I know there is so much more to learn! *oh, and bring cash. They do not accept credit cards.

As nice as it is to see functioned antique radio, television, telephony, morse etc equipment its even better to interact with the staff. They are volunteers and really love showing off the old equipment. You wont find more motivated people than these! They make the tours fun, interactive and they are quick to answer your questions!

As a former Radio Shack employee it was great to see some of the products still in everyday use. A lot of the stuff back in the day was built to last better than today's disposable electronics. Of particular note was an old 9V Radio Shack battery, not the cheap red batteries we used to give out with the battery of the month cards but one of the even earlier 'premium' 9Vs!

If I was going to deduct a star it would be that these devices are also used as a resource, sold off, split up, parted out etc. They are not making these antiques anymore. But its good to see them used and shown!
Great place to visit. Very friendly and very knowledgeable staff. It's an eye opening display of where we have come from in the world of technology.

name: Mill Woods Park
reviews: Been going here since I was a kid. Great memories and lots to do. Check out the Nature Center. It's awesome
Nice park with a summertime water feature.  Dog friendly.  Lots of Canadian Geese on the lower pond.  One large white swan on the upper.
Great park, nice playground and great soccer & baseball fields.
Great park with everything from playgrounds, swimming, fields, skate park, and much more! Fun for the whole family.

I used to live in that town and like the park always. This time I was even more impressed when I follow the signs to a dog park that they had way way way in the back of the park. Had a dream the lots of the wood chips that were done quite wet but it was still fun place to visit very shady for the pets

name: Adventure Rooms
address: 282 Main Street Extension, Middletown, CT 06457, USA
reviews: Lots of fun with friendly and helpful staff. We did the remedy and it was more challenging than expected, we only finished because they extended the time by an extra 5 or so minutes. Definitely read everything very carefully... If something looks like it should be used or is out of place, definitely use it!

We played two rooms The Hidden Cabin and the Swiss Original. They were two very different room. The Cabin was your standard, pretty well themed room with some fun and unique puzzles. Overall we had a great time in this room. Wouldn’t suggest more than 3-4 people due to the size however. 

The second room Swiss original was very different than normal rooms (and they make this very clear upfront.) It is a series of 3 rooms filled with puzzles with no theming or story line. This was an interesting experience. It felt like a sprint through puzzles (which was a good thing honestly). It was fun to really speed through several different puzzle types. 

Only down fall is it is difficult to find and the GM was helping two rooms at once which seemed to cause delays when we needed help on the very last puzzle.
Lots of fun. Done several rooms. One time one lock was not reset and I found that disappointing but it was just once.
Wonderfully awesome.  Super fun. Only did one puzzle so far but looking forward to trying the others
So much fun to do as a family reunion! You really get to see each person’s strengths. We did the Swiss Original which didn’t have a story but a lot of fun puzzles to solve over 3 rooms.

name: Corning Fountain
address: Horace Bushnell Promenade, Hartford, CT 06103, USA
reviews:
Interesting! No plaque to explain the
 Native Americans depicted or the relationship of Mr Corning with the site or the people. Very detailed sculptures!

Please where you can rest and hang out with friends out of the city noice. Great view at the capital building. The fountain itself is very interesting. There are four different native Amerikans 90 degree apart, and on the top there is deer or antelope or something similar.

Gorgeous fountain in the middle of a spacious field which lies at the foot of the hill in front of the state Capitol building. If you are near Bushnell Park, stop to see this, the CivilWar arch, and the carousel.
Finally the fountain got repaired after one and half year 😊
Nice place to relax in the heart of Hartford city...

name: New England Carousel Museum
reviews: I took my 3 1/2 year old grandson here and it my have been a little too much for him at this age, but I thoroughly enjoyed myself. The staff was very helpful and pleasant. I would definitely return with other family members.
Fun place to spend an hour or two. Nice collection of beautiful carousel houses and other animals. Also a craft area where the kids have a lot of fun. Fire history museum upstairs is also nice.

I went to check out the museum soon after I had moved to the area and was very impressed. The items on display show wonderful craftsmanship. I think it is a wonderful place to bring young children, and adults alike who like carousels and the history related to carousels. You even get a token for a free ride in one of the carousels. It also has an attached Firehouse museum which was very cool. Worth checking it out, definitely.

This place is fantastic!! We took our 4 kids (ages 8, 6, 4 and 10 months) and they loved it!! We loved it too! Such a fun place to explore and learn. Much bigger than we expected it to be and the price was GREAT! our tour guide, Elaine was WONDERFUL! She was great with the kids, so much fun and every informative. Highly recommend. Makes a great homeschool field trip too. Be sure to go through the Fire history as well! 
We will definitely be coming back soon.
A great display if horses.... Only a little child friendly. Child section is growing.

name: Penwood State Park
reviews: A really nice park to take a walk on an old paved trail. It is not that difficult. It takes a little over an hour to walk the loop at a moderate pace. Make sure to keep an eye on where you're walking because people here seem to let their dogs poop right in the middle of the trail so watch out for landmines.
Quiet and secluded. Restrooms are impeccable. Plenty of trees and grass. Great for dogs and children. Adults can have a good time too.
Numerous trails and look outs. Easy access. Good sized state park.
One of my favorite place to hike. There are a couple scenic overlooks. Around 4.8 mile hike,  when you take the yellow trail and then go on to the metacomet trail back to the parking lot.
Lots of trails. Dog friendly

name: Stanley Quarter Park
address: 451 Blake Rd, New Britain, CT 06053, USA
reviews: Beautiful park! Great place to take a relaxing walk around the pond, while enjoying the swimming geese. There is a nice playground for the kids, as well as soccer and tennis fields and plenty of free parking. Good spot to relax the mind and to decompress! 💕

Great park for walks, featuring woodland trails and a nice path around a lovely geese populated pond. Along the path are various fitness machines. You can find tennis and basketball courts, a skate rink, soccer field... This park has it all.

Good for a walk, jog, chill-out and even a play with the kids and/ or dog. Lots of construction and upkeep going on and it shows. At the right time of day you will have lots of space to yourself too. Careful with geese though,  you can easily find yourself the subject of many beady eyed fowl.

It's an ok part that needs the renovation be it's getting badly. It does have a pond to walk around, also wooded trails next to the skate park. The basketball courts I believe are getting redone currently 3/6/20 and they have baseball and soccer fields. The 4th of July fireworks are amazing here

One of my favorite places to go and relax and hang out. Always people walking around and enjoying nature,  which is refreshing to see in a city setting. Really nice to see people of all ages enjoying this park and skate park.

name: Wadsworth Falls State Park
reviews: Really cool place to take your kids. As soon as we got there and saw how beautiful the waterfalls were my kids were begging me to go in the water. We took awesome pictures and had a wonderful family day.

Really cool place to visit. The trail from the lower end to the larger falls gets very confusing, but to the lower falls is well marked. Both are beautiful. The connecting trail from the lower/smaller falls to the main trail seems to have been washed away, so I had to backtrack. If you’re going to see only the larger falls, you can almost access it directly from
the parking lot and there is a cool, fended-in, 1-person viewing platform over the larger falls.

Beautiful state park conveniently located in Middletown! Breath taking views of big waterfalls and the little falls if you wanna take a little hike its definitely worth it. It’s such a beautiful relaxing atmosphere.
Great waterfalls. They can be viewed from the top or the bottom. Several hiking trails with dome up/down hills but well kept. You will need to print a map as there ate no maps available at site.

Pretty park. Just be aware there are two ends, one, the main park, swimming in season and trails. Long walks to the falls. And the second entrance a few miles away offers almost immediate access to the falls. Depends on why you are there. Enjoy!

name: Nevers Park
address: Chief Ryan Way, South Windsor, CT 06074, USA
reviews: Nevers Park is wonderful all year round. I love the trails and the bucolic nature of it. The playground is outstanding! My two-year-old granddaughter loves it.

Nevers park is beautiful and well maintained. It's a place for everyone, whether you're up for a jog, a bike ride, or in the playground/skatepark with kids. There's graveled trails in the sun and in the shade.
Great park with playground, basketball, baseball court, skate park and woods.
Great park. Lots of structures for kids. Highly recommend. My only complaint is the limited restroom facilities.

Attended the strawberry festival. This was a great free family friendly community event. The park is lovely with a large playground, a beautiful exercise trail, a large pavilion and picnic area, many sports fields, and plenty of sunshine or shade depending on your needs.

name: Charter Oak Park
reviews: Charter Oak Park is one of Manchester, Connecticut's jewels. Recently upgraded, it is a great source of recreation for toddlers to grandparents. Easy access from downtown or I-384 with free parking. There are jogging/walking/bike trails along a river, ice skating in the winter, fields for softball, frisbee or flying kites, and basketball and tennis courts. Very popular are the two clean, inviting, engaging playgrounds, one for little ones and another for children of all ages. Don't miss the music garden.
This park was a good time. For everybody, Men, women, kids, dogs. A lot of attractions to keep you busy.

A very well designed park. Plenty of walking paths, access for dog walking, a nice play scape, basketball courts for the kids, tennis courts, and pretty well maintained at that. I give the landscaping team there big props for doing such a good job on the gardens.

Great park for kids. Has basketball courts, tennis courts,squash courts, music garden, soccer field, public restrooms. They also have a nice play scape with slides and monkey bars as well as a bunch of other stuff.  Overall a great experience

This park has been completely updated with gorgeous you paths, flowers, musical instruments, bushes, signage, murals, facilities, fields, courts, equipment, bike lockers and of course convenient access to the East Coast Greenway. Perfect place to get back to mother nature and enjoy a short walk along the brook. There's something for everyone and plenty of parking to boot. Bring your camera, bring your dog, bring your kids, sign up for one of the numerous on going classes and maybe try your hand at Geocaching. If you don't know what that is Google it, download the app and enjoy the fun and the community.

name: Roaring Brook Nature Center
reviews: Friendly knowledgeable staff . Cute gift shop. Also they help injured birds  in the Hope's to release them back into the wild. Donations are greatly appreciated.  Will definitely have to go back .
Great place to take your kids

We had my daughter Logan’s birthday party there and it was amazing!  The children had such a great time and learned so much about the animals and they loved the nature walk/hike! Logan had so much fun choosing the animals for the demonstration.  
Jay is wonderful and so knowledgeable! Thank you again to Jay and the entire staff !! Highly recommend!

Everyone respected me cause I cannot be around snakes.
The Hawks were simply outstanding. An all the other birds that have there own stories.

This place is absolutely the best for introducing your young child to the wonderful thing that go on in nature all around us. There are free trails behind the building, and the museum, while small is very good. A small gift shop is on site too. Great for birthday parties too!

name: Keeney Memorial Culture Center
reviews: Psychic Fair 4 times a year. Beautiful building.
There are some great historical exhibits inside here. We've been on the lantern tours two years in a row (around Halloween time) and can recommend them. Get tickets early as they will sell out.
Love the old building I go there for the Astrological Society Fair.  Love it
Great Psychic fair!!
Very nice and helpful attendant. The place to go for tips on what to visit in town.

name: Brownstone Exploration & Discovery Park
reviews: Fun place for active individuals that enjoy the water.  There’s so much to do here & they separate by age along with intensity level of what you are trying.  Plenty of lifeguards all over, but it’s always best to use your own judgement.  Definitely an all day event that will leave you exhausted!

Tons of fun to be had here!  With a wide variety of activities ranging from impressive zip lines to a relaxing day swimming and lounging in the sun, there is definitely fun to be had for everyone.  Most of my group got the full adventure pass and spent the day zip lining, riding the water slide, and climbing around on the inflatable water features.  The less adventurous people went with the less expensive swim pass and had just as much fun staying on the ground / in the water.  (they too had the option to use the floating water features). The floating trampoline was a particular hit with the kids in our group.  We rented a gazebo for the day and I can not recommend that enough.  The gazebo was floating attached to one of the docks and we could swim right off of it.  Definitely planning on getting a season pass next year and going as often as possible.   I was recommended to bring water shoes since there can be quite a bit of walking if you plan on doing a lot of zip lining, and I found that to be good advice.  That being said, plenty of people were barefoot all day and didn't seem too bothered by it.  Great place to spend the day, whether your goal is adventure or simple relaxation.
Fun place to go in the summer! Always a fun time here! Zip lining and jumping into the water was awesome here!

Pretty neat waterpark.  Several zip lines ending in water.  The middle has floaties for kids and adults to enjoy.  They also have a climbing wall you can scale either the old fashioned way or on a metal ladder.  Can be a bit of a line though with slow climbers.  Recommend you have shoes on for this.

Cool place be prepared for a workout you will leave here sore and tired. Oh and you can bring your own food and drinks cooler permitted and chairs. Great for an all day family event! Had tons of fun kids and adults will love it. They provide life jackets ugh but majority if not all are broken and falling apart with gashing holes and just icky only downside I could think of.

name: Batterson Park
address: Batterson Park Rd, Farmington, CT 06032, USA
reviews: It's a perfect place to bring your kids and dogs
It's just a place of relaxation..
Don't know if you're supposed to be swimming in here or not but we did and it was fun, very beautiful here
Our local little happy place!
Perfect place to fish with your Dad & others!

name: Salute
reviews:
All of our food was delicious, and obviously very fresh. Service was fantastic and she went out of her way to help us find stuff to do in the area. Cheese bread was good but nothing special. Complimentary biscotti was a nice touch for sure.
All in all, the prices ended up being really reasonable for lunch. Definitely going back again.

Visited this place for the first time.  The food was awesome, but most of all the service was amazing!  The place was packed, but you would never know it by the service we received.
